rajawali.scene

Class RajawaliScene

  • java.lang.Object
    • rajawali.renderer.AFrameTask
      • rajawali.scene.RajawaliScene

  • public class RajawaliScene
extends AFrameTask
    This is the container class for scenes in Rajawali. It is intended that children, lights, cameras and animations will be added to this object and this object will be added to the RajawaliRenderer instance.
    Author:
    Jared Woolston (jwoolston@tenkiv.com)

    • Nested Class Summary

      • Nested classes/interfaces inherited from class rajawali.renderer.AFrameTask

      • mCamera

        protected Camera mCamera
        The camera currently in use. Not thread safe for speed, should only be used by GL thread (onDrawFrame() and render()) or prior to rendering such as initScene().

      • mCameras

        private java.util.List<Camera> mCameras

      • mNextCamera

        private Camera mNextCamera
        Temporary camera which will be switched to by the GL thread. Guarded by mNextCameraLock

      • mNextCameraLock

        private final java.lang.Object mNextCameraLock

      • mFrameTaskQueue

        private java.util.LinkedList<AFrameTask> mFrameTaskQueue
        Frame task queue. Adding, removing or replacing members such as children, cameras, plugins, etc is now prohibited outside the use of this queue. The render thread will automatically handle the necessary operations at an appropriate time, ensuring thread safety and general correct operation. Guarded by itself

    • Method Detail

      • initSceneGraph

        protected void initSceneGraph()
        Automatically creates the specified scene graph type with that graph's default behavior. If you want to use a specific constructor you will need to override this method.

      • getSceneMinBound

        Fetch the minimum bounds of the scene.
        Returns:
        Vector3 containing the minimum values along each axis.

        Switches the Camera currently being used to display the scene.
        Parameters:
        mCamera - Camera object to display the scene with.

      • switchCamera

        public void switchCamera(int camera)
        Switches the Camera currently being used to display the scene.
        Parameters:
        camera - Index of the Camera to use.

      • getCamera

        public Camera getCamera()
        Fetches the Camera currently being used to display the scene. Note that the camera is not thread safe so this should be used with extreme caution.
        Returns:
        Camera object currently used for the scene.
        See Also:
        RajawaliRenderer#mCamera}

        Fetches the specified Camera.
        Parameters:
        camera - Index of the Camera to fetch.
        Returns:
        Camera which was retrieved.

      • addCamera

        public boolean addCamera(Camera camera)
        Adds a Camera to the scene.
        Parameters:
        camera - Camera object to add.
        Returns:
        boolean True if the addition was successfully queued.

      • addCameras

        public boolean addCameras(java.util.Collection<Camera> cameras)
        Adds a Collection of Camera objects to the scene.
        Parameters:
        cameras - Collection of Camera objects to add.
        Returns:
        boolean True if the addition was successfully queued.

      • removeCamera

        public boolean removeCamera(Camera camera)
        Removes a Camera from the scene. If the Camera being removed is the one in current use, the 0 index Camera will be selected on the next frame.
        Parameters:
        camera - Camera object to remove.
        Returns:
        boolean True if the removal was successfully queued.

      • replaceCamera

        public boolean replaceCamera(Camera camera,
                    int location)
        Replaces a Camera in the renderer at the specified location in the list. This does not validate the index, so if it is not contained in the list already, an exception will be thrown. If the Camera being replaced is the one in current use, the replacement will be selected on the next frame.
        Parameters:
        camera - Camera object to add.
        location - Integer index of the camera to replace.
        boolean - True if the replacement was successfully queued.

      • replaceCamera

        public boolean replaceCamera(Camera oldCamera,
                    Camera newCamera)
        Replaces the specified Camera in the renderer with the provided Camera. If the Camera being replaced is the one in current use, the replacement will be selected on the next frame.
        Parameters:
        oldCamera - Camera object to be replaced.
        newCamera - Camera object replacing the old.
        boolean - True if the replacement was successfully queued.

      • registerAnimation

        public boolean registerAnimation(Animation3D anim)
        Register an animation to be managed by the scene. This is optional leaving open the possibility to manage updates on Animations in your own implementation.
        Parameters:
        anim - Animation3D to be registered.
        Returns:
        boolean True if the registration was queued successfully.

      • unregisterAnimation

        public boolean unregisterAnimation(Animation3D anim)
        Remove a managed animation. If the animation is not a member of the scene, nothing will happen.
        Parameters:
        anim - Animation3D to be unregistered.
        Returns:
        boolean True if the unregister was queued successfully.

        newAnim - Animation3D the new animation.
        Returns:
        boolean True if the replacement task was queued successfully.

      • setSkybox

        public void setSkybox(int posx,
             int negx,
             int posy,
             int negy,
             int posz,
             int negz)
               throws ATexture.TextureException
        Creates a skybox with the specified 6 textures.
        Parameters:
        posx - int Resource id for the front face.
        negx - int Resource id for the right face.
        posy - int Resource id for the back face.
        negy - int Resource id for the left face.
        posz - int Resource id for the up face.
        negz - int Resource id for the down face.
        Throws:
        ATexture.TextureException

      • updateSkybox

        public void updateSkybox(int resourceId)
                  throws java.lang.Exception
        Updates the sky box textures with a single texture.
        Parameters:
        resourceId - int the resource id of the new texture.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • updateSkybox

        public void updateSkybox(int front,
                int right,
                int back,
                int left,
                int up,
                int down)
                  throws java.lang.Exception
        Updates the sky box textures with 6 new resource ids.
        Parameters:
        front - int Resource id for the front face.
        right - int Resource id for the right face.
        back - int Resource id for the back face.
        left - int Resource id for the left face.
        up - int Resource id for the up face.
        down - int Resource id for the down face.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • reload

        public void reload()
        Reloads this scene.

      • clear

        public void clear()
        Clears the scene of contents. Note that this is NOT the same as destroying the scene.

      • hasPickerInfo

        public boolean hasPickerInfo()
        Is the object picking info?
        Returns:
        boolean True if object picking is active.

      • resetGLState

        public void resetGLState()
        Applies the Rajawali default GL state to the driver. Developers who wish to change this default behavior can override this method.

      • render

        public void render(double deltaTime,
          RenderTarget renderTarget)

      • queueAddTask

        public boolean queueAddTask(AFrameTask task)
        Queue an addition task. The added object will be placed at the end of the renderer's list.
        Parameters:
        task - AFrameTask to be added.
        Returns:
        boolean True if the task was successfully queued.

      • queueAddTask

        public boolean queueAddTask(AFrameTask task,
                   int index)
        Queue an addition task. The added object will be placed at the specified index in the renderer's list, or the end if out of range.
        Parameters:
        task - AFrameTask to be added.
        index - Integer index to place the object at.
        Returns:
        boolean True if the task was successfully queued.

      • queueRemoveTask

        protected boolean queueRemoveTask(AFrameTask.TYPE type,
                      int index)
        Queue a removal task. The removal will occur at the specified index, or at the end of the list if out of range.
        Parameters:
        type - AFrameTask.TYPE Which list to remove from.
        index - Integer index to remove the object at.
        Returns:
        boolean True if the task was successfully queued.

      • queueRemoveTask

        protected boolean queueRemoveTask(AFrameTask task)
        Queue a removal task to remove the specified object.
        Parameters:
        task - AFrameTask to be removed.
        Returns:
        boolean True if the task was successfully queued.

      • queueReplaceTask

        protected boolean queueReplaceTask(int index,
                       AFrameTask replacement)
        Queue a replacement task to replace the object at the specified index with a new one. Replaces the object at the end of the list if index is out of range.
        Parameters:
        index - Integer index of the object to replace.
        replacement - AFrameTask the object replacing the old.
        Returns:
        boolean True if the task was successfully queued.

      • queueReplaceTask

        protected boolean queueReplaceTask(AFrameTask task,
                       AFrameTask replacement)
        Queue a replacement task to replace the specified object with the new one.
        Parameters:
        task - AFrameTask the object to replace.
        replacement - AFrameTask the object replacing the old.
        Returns:
        boolean True if the task was successfully queued.

      • queueAddAllTask

        protected boolean queueAddAllTask(java.util.Collection<AFrameTask> collection)
        Queue an add all task to add all objects from the given collection.
        Parameters:
        collection - Collection containing all the objects to add.
        Returns:
        boolean True if the task was successfully queued.

      • queueClearTask

        protected boolean queueClearTask(AFrameTask.TYPE type)
        Queue a remove all task which will clear the related list.
        Parameters:
        type - AFrameTask.TYPE Which object list to clear (Cameras, BaseObject3D, etc)
        Returns:
        boolean True if the task was successfully queued.

      • queueRemoveAllTask

        protected boolean queueRemoveAllTask(java.util.Collection<AFrameTask> collection)
        Queue a remove all task which will remove all objects from the given collection from the related list.
        Parameters:
        collection - Collection containing all the objects to be removed.
        Returns:
        boolean True if the task was successfully queued.

        Adds a task to the frame task queue.
        Parameters:
        task - AFrameTask to be added.
        Returns:
        boolean True on successful addition to queue.

      • internalReplaceAnimation

        private void internalReplaceAnimation(AFrameTask anim,
                            Animation3D replace,
                            int index)
        Internal method for replacing a Animation3D object. If index is AFrameTask.UNUSED_INDEX then it will be used, otherwise the replace object is used. Should only be called through handleAddTask(AFrameTask)
        Parameters:
        anim - AFrameTask The old animation.
        replace - Animation3D The animation replacing the old animation.
        index - integer index to effect. Set to AFrameTask.UNUSED_INDEX if not used.

      • internalAddAnimation

        private void internalAddAnimation(Animation3D anim,
                        int index)
        Internal method for adding Animation3D objects. Should only be called through handleAddTask(AFrameTask) This takes an index for the addition, but it is pretty meaningless.
        Parameters:
        anim - Animation3D to add.
        int - index to add the animation at.

      • internalRemoveAnimation

        private void internalRemoveAnimation(Animation3D anim,
                           int index)
        Internal method for removing Animation3D objects. Should only be called through handleRemoveTask(AFrameTask) This takes an index for the removal.
        Parameters:
        anim - Animation3D to remove. If index is used, this is ignored.
        index - integer index to remove the child at.

      • internalClearAnimations

        private void internalClearAnimations()
        Internal method for removing all Animation3D objects. Should only be called through handleRemoveAllTask(AFrameTask)

      • internalReplaceCamera

        private void internalReplaceCamera(AFrameTask camera,
                         Camera replace,
                         int index)
        Internal method for replacing a Camera. If index is AFrameTask.UNUSED_INDEX then it will be used, otherwise the replace object is used. Should only be called through handleReplaceTask(AFrameTask)
        Parameters:
        camera - Camera The old camera.
        replace - Camera The camera replacing the old camera.
        index - integer index to effect. Set to AFrameTask.UNUSED_INDEX if not used.

      • internalAddCamera

        private void internalAddCamera(Camera camera,
                     int index)
        Internal method for adding a Camera. Should only be called through handleAddTask(AFrameTask) This takes an index for the addition, but it is pretty meaningless.
        Parameters:
        camera - Camera to add.
        int - index to add the camera at.

      • internalRemoveCamera

        private void internalRemoveCamera(Camera camera,
                        int index)
        Internal method for removing a Camera. Should only be called through handleRemoveTask(AFrameTask) This takes an index for the removal. NOTE: If there is only one camera and it is removed, bad things will happen.
        Parameters:
        camera - Camera to remove. If index is used, this is ignored.
        index - integer index to remove the camera at.

      • internalClearCameras

        private void internalClearCameras()
        Internal method for removing all Camera from the camera list. Should only be called through handleRemoveAllTask(AFrameTask) Note that this will re-add the current camera.

      • getCamerasCopy

        public java.util.ArrayList<Camera> getCamerasCopy()
        Creates a shallow copy of the internal cameras list.
        Returns:
        ArrayList containing the cameras.

        Retrieve the number of cameras.
        Returns:
        The current number of cameras.

        Parameters:

        replace - ALight The light replacing the old light.
        index - integer index to effect. Set to AFrameTask.UNUSED_INDEX if not used.

        Parameters:

        index - integer index to remove the light at.

      • updateMaterialsWithLights

        private void updateMaterialsWithLights()
        Set the lights on all materials used in this scene. This method should only be called when the lights collection is dirty. It will trigger compilation of all light-enabled shaders.

      • updateChildMaterialWithLights

        private void updateChildMaterialWithLights(Object3D child)
        Update the lights on this child's material. This method should only be called when the lights collection is dirty. It will trigger compilation of all light-enabled shaders.
        Parameters:
        child -

      • destroyScene

        public void destroyScene()
        Clears any references the scene is holding for its contents. This does not clear the items themselves as they may be held by some other scene.

      • setBackgroundColor

                      float green,
                      float blue,
                      float alpha)

        Parameters:
        red - float red component (0-1.0f).
        green - float green component (0-1.0f).
        blue - float blue component (0-1.0f).
        alpha - float alpha component (0-1.0f).

      • alwaysClearColorBuffer

        public void alwaysClearColorBuffer(boolean value)
        Indicate that the color buffer should be cleared on every frame. This is set to true by default. Reasons for settings this to false might be integration with augmented reality frameworks or other OpenGL based renderers.
        Parameters:
        value -

                          int height)

        height - in the new viewport height in pixes.
